unnormalised: Breaking News: RBI has just updated the KYC norms, folks! Starting 10/11/2024, you'll need to link your PAN card (e.g., ABCDE1234F) to your bank a/c to keep it active. Seems like a hassle, but it’s all about keeping things secure, right?
normalised: Breaking News: R-B-I has just updated the K-Y-C norms, folks! Starting tenth november two thousand and twenty four, you'll need to link your P-A-N card (e.g., A-B-C-D-E one two three four F) to your bank account to keep it active. Seems like a hassle, but it's all about keeping things secure, right?

unnormalised: Also, remember that new rule about updating your IFSC code. HDFC Bank's IFSC, for example, might look something like HDFC0000123. Make sure yours is correct, or transactions might bounce! Contact your bank directly; don’t trust random emails asking for your details. Phishing is rampant, yaar!
normalised: Also, remember that new rule about updating your I-F-S-C code. H-D-F-C Bank's I-F-S-C, for example, might look something like H-D-F-C zero zero zero zero one two three. Make sure yours is correct, or transactions might bounce! Contact your bank directly; don't trust random emails asking for your details. Phishing is rampant, yaar!

unnormalised: Speaking of security, keep an eye on those OTPs! Never share them with anyone, even if they claim to be from SBI or Axis Bank. Your CVV number (that 3-digit code on the back of your card) is also top secret. Treat it like your personal James Bond password!
normalised: Speaking of security, keep an eye on those O-T-P-s! Never share them with anyone, even if they claim to be from S-B-I or Axis Bank. Your C-V-V number (that three-digit code on the back of your card) is also top secret. Treat it like your personal James Bond password!

unnormalised: And if you’re investing in mutual funds, remember to note down your Folio Number (could be something like 1234567890). It’s crucial for tracking your investments. All this stuff can be a bit confusing, but think of it as adulting 101, okay?
normalised: And if you're investing in mutual funds, remember to note down your Folio Number (could be something like one two three four five six seven eight nine zero). It's crucial for tracking your investments. All this stuff can be a bit confusing, but think of it as adulting one zero one, okay?

unnormalised: Finally, NSDL and CDSL demat a/c holders, check that your registered mobile no. is updated. Seems basic, but it's key to getting alerts for all your transactions. Stay safe, stay informed, and happy banking, people!
